head.title: POSTINGS: A Legal Seminar on Property Valuation; Deciding What It's Worth

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: POSTINGS: A Legal Seminar on Property Valuation; Deciding What It's Worth

abstract.p: Seminar on different rules of property valuation is to be presented May 10 under joint sponsorship of Appraisal Institute and Condemnation Law Committee of New York County Lawyers' Association (S)

block.p: A seminar on the different rules of property valuation is to be presented Wednesday under the joint sponsorship of the Appraisal Institute and the Condemnation Law Committee of the New York County Lawyers' Association. The program is titled, ''What's It Worth -- Who Wants to Know: Valuation of Real Property in Litigation,''and will be held from 5:30 to 8:30 p.m. at the Bar Association's building, 14 Vesey Street.

The program will feature a panel of appraisers and lawyers who will explore valuation issues for condemnation, real estate tax reduction proceedings and matrimonial cases, but will not be limited to those areas. The program is also expected to be of interest to lawyers and appraisers wanting to learn valuation methods and principles.

A seminar on the different rules of property valuation is to be presented Wednesday under the joint sponsorship of the Appraisal Institute and the Condemnation Law Committee of the New York County Lawyers' Association. The program is titled, ''What's It Worth -- Who Wants to Know: Valuation of Real Property in Litigation,''and will be held from 5:30 to 8:30 p.m. at the Bar Association's building, 14 Vesey Street.

The program will feature a panel of appraisers and lawyers who will explore valuation issues for condemnation, real estate tax reduction proceedings and matrimonial cases, but will not be limited to those areas. The program is also expected to be of interest to lawyers and appraisers wanting to learn valuation methods and principles.

In focusing on the rules and practices in New York City, the panel will offer insights into the different rules of valuation that apply in different proceedings, how to value different types of property, how to value specific interests in real property and how to work effectively with an appraiser in litigation.
The program chairmen are Michael Rikon of Goldstein, Goldstein & Rikon and Daniel F. Sciannameo of Albert Valuation Group.
The cost is $115 for nonmembers, $75 for members. To register: 267-6646, ext. 215.
